title: Multi-languages Websites with Quarto!
text:
Multilanguage support (en/de)
To use multi language support, I make use of quarto profiles.
Some ideas are from here.
Current approach

We create two profiles: en / de
Each has its own YAML file: _quarto-en.yml and quarto-de.yml. In these yaml files, the output-dir is specified for each profile1
We specify a default profile using groups
We conditionally show content using divs with the .content-visible when-profile="en" syntax
To Render, you must specify a profile (e.g. --profile en). In the current setup (where en is in the docs root directory and de is in a subdirectory), you need to append --no-clean if en is run after de
To publish, you cannot use quarto publish anymore, since this is output-dir-aware. We could either use netlify with the netlify-cli or use gh-pages and version the output-dir. The latter method is very simple, ableit being not-so-elegant. Netlify would have the big advantage of redirects, see below.
If you use

Netlify: In the root dir, specify a _redirects to direct users to one of the subsites (since the root is empty)
gh-pages: create a redirects html pages

title: Multi-languages Websites with Quarto!
text:
Footnotes


Currently, we use github-pages without the gh-pages branch and without quarto publish because these functionalities don’t play well with nested output-dirs. So a simple setup is to use docs as the output-dir of the default language (e.g. english) and docs/de for the secondary langauge (e.g. german).↩︎

title: Multi-languages Websites with Quarto!
text: Vegetation is recorded by means of so-called “vegetation surveys” on defined sample patches of typically 0.1-400 m2. These contain information on all vascular plant species present and often also mosses and lichens, their proportions and environmental parameters recorded on site. This means that the information content of vegetation surveys is considerably greater and allows more in-depth analyses than observational data on individual species. For example, biodiversity mass or mean ecological indicator values can be determined and their changes in space and time analyzed.
